name: cao jiannong
personal background:
<Prof. Cao is currently the Otto Poon Charitable Foundation Professor in Data Science and the Chair Professor of Distributed and Mobile Computing in the Department of Computing at The Hong Kong Polytechnic University (PolyU), Hong Kong. He is also the Dean of Graduate School, the director of Research Institute for Artificial Intelligence of Things (RIAIoT) in PolyU, the director of the Internet and Mobile Computing Lab (IMCL).>

<He was the founding director and now the director of PolyU's University's Research Facility in Big Data Analytics (UBDA). He served the department head from 2011 to 2017.>

<Prof. Cao is a member of Academia Europaea, a fellow of the Hong Kong Academy of Engineering Science, a fellow of IEEE, a fellow of China Computer Federation (CCF) and an ACM distinguished member.>

<He also obtained 16 patents. Prof. He also obtained 16 patents.> * Prof. Cao has also actively served Hong Kong local professional communities, including Entrepreneurship Advisor of HK A.I. Lab.
* Prof. Cao has also actively served Hong Kong local professional communities, including member of HK Innovation and Technology Fund Research Projects Assessment Panel
* Prof. Cao has also actively served Hong Kong local professional communities, including member of Engineering Panel of Hong Kong Research Grant Council
* Prof. Cao has also actively served Hong Kong local professional communities, including member of Incu-Tech Business Incubation Programme Panel of Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks
* Prof. Cao has also actively served Hong Kong local professional communities, including member of HKIE’s Accreditation Committee for Computer Science Programmes. <Jiannong Cao is a researcher with multiple publications in various fields including computer communications, neural networks, knowledge and data engineering, dependable and secure computing, intelligent transportation systems, and network security. His research interests include continual learning, federated learning, and distributed systems.> <Chen Fengwei Zhang Jiannong Cao is a researcher, but no specific background information found>
research interest:
<Prof. Cao’s research interests include distributed systems and blockchain, wireless sensing and networking, big data and machine learning, and mobile cloud and edge computing. He published 5 co-authored and 9 co-edited books, and over 800 papers in major international journals and conference proceedings. He also obtained 16 patents. His current and ongoing projects include High-performance Collaborative Edge Computing Enabling Smart City Applications: Frameworks and Methodologies, HK RGC Theme-based Research Scheme (TRS), 2024/01-2028/12 Heterogeneity-aware Collaborative Edge AI Acceleration, HK RGC Collaborative Research Fund (CRF), 2024/06 - 2027/05 Blockchain-based> data management and sharing for digital aircrafts,
Data-driven Hospitalization Chance Prediction and USR Level Modeling,
Efficient Scheduling of Integrated Cloud-Edge-End Computing Power for AI-enabled Applications, 
Hierarchical Distributed Reinforcement Learning for Low-latency Autonomous Cooperation in Collaborative Edge Computing,
DM-BIM: A Blockchain-based Platform for Decentralized Management of Building Information Models.
